Dear Katrina Edmon:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15
days from the date of the exit conference, must be completed and routed in CWLM, and must
include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
the area manager Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Shannon (Shay) Mavis, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/29/25, a youth was punched in the head by another youth.
The youth reported his head and area between their shoulder
blades to be sore. A staff member was standing outside and
observed the incident but did not intervene.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant was interviewed via phone on 5/1/25.
Complainant reported she did not have any further information
about the allegations.
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/5/25.
Director reported the incident occurred out by the bridge area,
which is on the other side of campus, and the area does not have
cameras.
Youth A was interviewed via video conference on 5/6/25.
Youth A reported he went AWOL from the facility but remained on
campus in the woods. Youth A reported when he exited the
woods, he heard Youth D yelling his name repeatedly like he was
looking for Youth A. Youth A reported he walked towards Youth
D’s voice and saw Youth C, Youth D and Staff 1 standing
together. Youth A reported Youth C grabbed his shirt and ripped it.
Youth A reported Staff 1 stood there and watched it happen, but
did not say anything or intervene. Youth A reported he cussed at
Youth C and told him to stop. Youth A reported Youth C pulled
him to the ground and punched him in the head and shoulder
more than once but wasn’t sure how many times he was punched.
Youth A reported Staff 1 continued to stand there watching, but
did not intervene or say anything. Youth A reported Youth D was
off to the side talking to Youth E when this was occurring. Youth A
reported Youth C stopped hitting him and then began bossing him
around by telling Youth A to “stay down”. Youth A reported Youth
C said a bunch of mean things to him (couldn’t remember what)
and yelled at him. Youth A reported Staff 1 told him to get up and
walk to the cottage. Youth A reported he got up, began walking,
and then cussed at Youth C again. Youth A reported Youth C
pulled him to the ground a second time and punched him again.
2

Youth A reported Staff 1 stood there again and did nothing. Youth
A reported he tried to hide behind Staff 1, and Staff 1 said, “don’t
hide behind me. You’re the one who swore at him”. Youth A
reported while walking to the cottage, Youth C attempted to hit
him again but was unsuccessful. Youth A reported when he got
back to the cottage, Staff 2 was present and saw what happened,
so he separated Youth C from Youth A. Youth A reported he and
Youth C were separated for the rest of the night, and later in the
evening, Youth C apologized to him. Youth A reported Youth B
wasn’t present when the incident occurred.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at his school on 5/5/25.
Youth C reported he was in the cottage when Youth B came back
from AWOL and said “[Youth A] is having sex with [Youth E] in the
woods and has a hickey on his neck”. Youth C reported he and
Youth D walked out of the cottage to find Youth A and Youth E
because they were AWOL. Youth C reported Staff 1 came with he
and Youth D. Youth C reported they went to the bridge near the
administration building and Youth A began walking towards them,
yelling their names. Youth C reported Youth E was running behind
Youth A and it looked like Youth E was going to push, grab, or
attack Youth A, so Youth C pushed Youth A to the side. Youth C
reported Youth D pushed Youth B backwards. Youth C reported
he, Youth D and Staff 1 convinced Youth A to come back to the
cottage with them. Youth C reported Youth E was really upset and
walked off. Youth C reported when they got back to the cottage,
Youth A was emotionally heightened and Youth C guessed it was
because Youth A got raped in the woods by Youth E. Youth C
reported Youth A began talking bad about Youth C’s family, which
upset Youth C, so he yelled at Youth A twice to stop. Youth C
reported he was going to take a walk, but Youth A followed him,
and they got in each other’s faces. Youth C reported he pushed
Youth A back and punched Youth A in the head one time because
Youth A wouldn’t back off. Youth C reported Staff 1 and Staff 2
were present and immediately got in between them and separated
them. Youth C reported he only hit Youth A one time. Youth C
reported after they were separated, Staff 1 spoke with Youth C
and Youth D while Staff 2 spoke with Youth A. Youth C reported
Youth B was not present for the incident because Youth B was
inside the cottage. Youth C reported Youth E was still AWOL
when the incident occurred, so he didn’t see what happened.
Youth C reported the only people who witnessed what happened
were Staff 1, Staff 2, and Youth D.
Youth D was interviewed face to face at his school on 5/5/25.
Youth D reported he was in the cottage when Youth B came back
3

from being AWOL and stated Youth A was in the woods with
Youth E and had a hickey on his neck. Youth D reported Youth C
left the cottage, so he followed Youth C. Youth D reported Youth
C was by the administration building with Youth A. When Youth D
arrived, he saw Youth C grab Youth A by his shirt and hit Youth A
in the head approximately 10 times and rip his shirt. Youth D
reported Staff 1 came up to the situation right after him and he
thinks Staff 1 saw most of the situation happen, but Staff 1 did
nothing to stop it. Youth D reported Youth C stopped fighting
Youth A because Staff 1 told Youth C to get off Youth A, and he
did. Youth D reported although Staff 1 told Youth C to stop, Youth
D felt Staff 1 took too long to say anything. Youth D reported he
thinks Staff 1 didn’t step in earlier because Youth C has fought
staff before and Youth D thinks Staff 1 didn’t want Youth C to fight
him. Youth D reported Youth E was present and saw the situation
happen as well, but Youth B was not present as he was in the
cottage.
Youth E was interviewed via video conference on 5/16/25.
Youth E reported he wasn’t present for the whole situation and
walked up when it was already happening. Youth E reported
Youth A had just come out of the woods. Youth E reported Youth
C was mad at Youth A because Youth C thought Youth E raped
Youth A even though he didn’t. Youth E reported Youth C told
Youth A not to go into the woods again and Youth C pulled Youth
A backwards by his hair. Youth E could not remember if Youth C
hit Youth A. Youth E reported Staff 1 arrived before him, but Staff
1 didn’t get there in time to stop the fight. Youth E reported as
soon as Staff 1 arrived, Youth C stopped what he was doing and
walked away. Youth E reported Youth B was present for the
situation, but he couldn’t remember if Staff 2 was present or not.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on 5/22/25. Staff 1 reported
Youth A, Youth B and Youth E were AWOL. Staff 1 reported
Youth C was in the cottage when Youth B returned and stated
Youth A was in the woods with Youth E. Staff 1 reported Youth C
and Youth D ran out of the cottage to find Youth A, and when they
found him, Youth C was trying to convince him to come back to
the cottage. Staff 1 reported Youth A began calling Youth C gay
and racial slurs. Staff 1 reported Youth C swung his fist and hit
Youth A on the side of his head behind his ear/by his temple. Staff
1 reported he immediately got in between Youth A and Youth C to
separate them. Staff 1 reported gay and racial slurs are a trigger
for Youth C, so Staff 1 didn’t want anything to escalate further.
Staff 1 reported Youth A said, “don’t hit me bitch”, and then said
more gay and racial slurs towards Youth C. Staff 1 reported Youth
4

C said, “I’m trying to help you [Youth A]!”. Staff 1 reported Youth C
was yelling so loud at Youth A trying to convince him he was
helping that Youth A may not have realized Youth C was trying to
help him. Staff 1 reported Youth C tried to convince Youth A to
come back to the cottage and said, “you don’t want to sit out here
with [Youth E] out here because you don’t want [Youth E] to do
something to you”, but Youth A didn’t want to leave. Staff 1
reported Youth A said, “leave me alone”. Staff 1 reported he tried
to talk to Youth A and tell Youth A Youth D was right because
Youth E was not someone Youth A wants to be in the woods with.
Staff 1 reported Youth A began walking back to the cottage, so
Staff 1, Youth C, Youth D and Youth E followed him back to the
cottage. Staff 1 reported when they arrived back at the cottage,
Youth C apologized to Youth A and Youth C encouraged Youth A
not to be a follower, not to go AWOL, etc. Staff 1 reported he
doesn’t recall Youth A’s shirt being ripped, and if it was, he didn’t
see how it got ripped. Staff 1 reported Youth A stumbled when
Youth C hit him, but Youth A never fell to the ground and was
never pulled to the ground by Youth C. Staff 1 reported Youth C
only hit Youth A one time, and did not punch him multiple times.
Staff 1 reported Youth C never told Youth A to “stay down”
because Youth A was never on the ground. Staff 1 reported Staff
2 and Youth B were in the cottage and were not present for the
incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 5/22/25. Staff 2 reported
Youth A went AWOL with Youth B earlier in the day, and Youth E
was already AWOL. Staff 2 reported Youth E came back to the
cottage and stated Youth A and Youth B were in the woods
together. Staff 2 reported Youth A and Youth B came back to the
cottage and Youth A was hysterical. Staff 2 reported Youth C was
being loud and said to Youth A, “you gay and you went out to the
woods with Youth B. You just got fucked”. Staff 2 reported Youth
D was also outside teasing Youth A and trying to antagonize the
situation by saying Youth A was gay and went to the woods with
Youth B. Staff 2 reported Youth A was crying and said, “shut the
fuck up talking to me” to Youth C. Staff 2 reported Youth C didn’t
like Youth A standing up for himself, so Youth C kept antagonizing
Youth A and talking about what might have happened between
Youth A and Youth B in the woods. Staff 2 reported Youth A got
into Youth C’s face and told him to shut up again. Staff 2 reported
Youth C hit Youth A twice in the face quickly. Staff 2 reported he
immediately intervened and separated Youth A and Youth C. Staff
2 reported Youth A ran away towards the playground to get away
from the situation, and Youth C walked off too. Staff 2 reported
Youth A came back, and Youth C tried to come at Youth A again,
5

so Staff 2 stepped in between them and escorted Youth A to his
room. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was outside with him when this
situation was occurring and neither of them stood around doing
nothing. Staff 2 reported he was trying to talk Youth C down when
Youth A came back out and started talking crap to Youth C. Staff
2 reported Youth A said, “I don’t care, I say what I want”. Staff 2
reported Staff 1 tried to talk Youth A down and told him to stop
antagonizing the situation further while Staff 2 continued to try to
de-escalate Youth C. Staff 2 reported he doesn’t remember Youth
B or Youth E being outside when the incident occurred.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Physical Intervention Policy states staff must utilize a
variety of behavior management and crisis intervention
techniques including relationship building, managing the
environment, active listening, crisis co-regulation, emotional
first aid, and other early interventions to de-escalate crisis.
• Staff 1 does not have any disciplinary action in his
employee file. Staff 1 completed CPI training during new
employee training after his hire date on 11/25/24.
• Staff 2 does not have any disciplinary action in his
employee file. Staff 1 completed CPI training during new
employee training after his hire date on 3/10/25.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as the interviews conducted
with youth and staff were inconsistent regarding who was present
and what occurred, therefore there is not enough information to
support staff failed to intervene in an altercation between Youth A
and Youth C.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff did not complete an incident report as required by the
facility's policy.
Investigation
6

INTERVIEWS:
Director was interviewed face to face at the facility on 5/5/25.
Director reported he wasn’t aware Youth C punched Youth A and
doesn’t believe that information was listed in any incident reports.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Email from Director dated 6/4/25 confirms there was not an
incident report completed for Youth C hitting Youth A.
• Reporting and Documenting Critical Incidents Policy states
staff are required to document any incidents that pertain to
a youth’s safety, health, or well-being. If multiple staff
witness an unusual or critical incident, all staff should
complete separate incident reports. Staff must complete
incident reports that involve any unusual or extraordinary
events. Critical incidents are of the following specific
unusual incidents: incidents involving injury and aggression
or violence. Staff must complete incident reports in its
entirety by the end of their shift and turn them into the
designated box in the cottage for supervisor review. Failure
to document is considered a work rule violation.
• Staff 1 does not have any disciplinary action in his
employee file. Staff 1 completed Incident Reporting training
during new employee training after his hire date on
11/25/24.
• Staff 2 does not have any disciplinary action in his
employee file. Staff 1 completed Incident Reporting training
during new employee training after his hire date on 3/10/25.
Analysis The facility is found in violation as per the interview with and email
from Director, an incident report was not completed regarding the
altercation between Youth A and Youth C.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
